message:
Hi,
Just released our private beta of Sparkwall and we would love to hear your feedback! 

Sparkwall is a visual collaboration tool that helps remote dev and creative teams communicate by sharing designs in real time.  The app is built on node.js, socket.io and MongoDB using Amazon EC2 and S3 for hosting and storage.

Invitation Code: HACKERNEWS 
Sign up: http://sparkwall.me

Thanks
Johan Ekhager Co-founder / CTO
Was looking for a rubber or a trashcan to drop into ;)
Thanks guys :)
awesome, just awesome
How do I trash the object ?
I'm looking forward using this for remote brainstorming. Good piece of app!!!
Just use deletebutton to trash objects.
Ah, I see :P Just curious, do you think it should be a trashcan?
Just signed up for a beta invite, looks pretty awesome :)
Think I invited you know, checked the mail database :P
@johanekhager Thanks for the invite, I agree with the others, there should be a trashcan :)
Ah ok, interesting! We never thought it needed a trashcan. Thought users wanted to delete the same way as they do on their desktop. Will rethink trashcan! Thanks for the feedback! :)

I really love it, simple yet unique with a nice clean design! I agree with the trash can or having a delete button on the sidebar not a lot of people will think of the whole using the keyboard thing! But definitely an amazing service will be using it in future!
Looks cool.  Bookmarked for potential future use.  A rectangle and circle drawing feature might be nice.
Love it to death so far
Is this using HTML 5 caching?

Thanks guys! Good to know with the trashcan. Yeah, we will create different shapes and not only the "line tool", working on that! Btw, what would you use rectangle and circle tool for? I would use it to mindmapping. :)
It's actually not using HTML5 caching, mostly because we still in develop phase. Will use caching when we release v1.0, for sure!
@johanekhager This looks awesome! Any chance I could get an invite? scottbnel@gmail.com
Very interesting; I can see myself using this tool for remote project collaboration.

It would be nice to have keyboard shortcuts to change tools, e.g. hit 't' for text tool, 'm' for move, etc. You could probably just copy the shortcuts that Photoshop uses for their similarly labeled tools.
@scttnlsn You're invited!
@jperras Thx for the comments. I agree with you, I love shortcuts and it's in the dev plan. Hope we can implement it soon!
@johanekhager This is incredibly well done.  Thanks!
Looks great, just signed up for an invite with: oliver@taptivate.com.
You are invited!
bloddy brilliant. can see myself using that heavily with a lot of clients.
@bytejunkie Thanks a lot! :) Would love to hear some feedback from you!

@johanekhager I'm really liking it so far...one thing though, I think it would be nice to be able to resize sticky notes. I know I can zoom in and see them better, but since I can resize everything else, I think I should be able to do the same for sticky notes... Also the "trashcan" would really be a valuable addition.
@CrowderSoup Yeah, the sticky note doesn't really play without the resize. Will fix that! Also the trashcan! :) Good to get this kind of feedback, it helps us so much to set priority on our tasks!
Well it looks great from the outside... looking forward to trying it out Johane
Wow. Just signed up for beta invite.
@Inc82 Thanks, I'll sent an invite now. Hope it looks good from the inside as well. ;) Please let me know your thoughts here!

Also I think some of the default sizing wasn't quite intuitive to me.. I added a picture and it was tiny.. then I realized how big the wall really was and I had to zoom in to look at hte picture normally.... but then I added a sticky note and the sticky note was quite a bit bigger then my picture at about 400px wide.. that's pretty big I thought .. so I had to adjust things ... those are minor though.. its pretty cool

Hey looks great from the inside as well @johanekhager .. What might be interesting is if you had some project planning templates.. something like this: http://ingenia.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/business-model-generation_9canvas1.jpg

@Inc82 Thanks for your feedback! Interesting, we talked about templates this morning where business model was one of them. Good to know that you would like to have templates! About the sizing, what do you think of removing the zoom and show everything at scale 1:1? I've also heard the zoom isn't really intuitive from several others. Sticky notes aren't relative to images and it's on our todo list, you should be able to resize it as well as images.

The Zoom one is interesting.. I think having zoom might be ok, if the default sizing of things was a bit more .. intuitive? You could adopt a (forgive me as i don't really play it much) starcraft esque approach?   Everything is 1:1, except you have a small map feature with a box that you can move around...    Or you could default with that.. but still allow people to zoom how to get a bigger picture.. just some ideas ;)
i like the idea of the zoom, it really works for me that its a big whiteboard and you can zoom in and out of areas...
I agree with @Bytejunkie, I just think its important to find a way to use it that makes sense.
keyboard shortcuts for the tools would be awesome ('t' -> text tool, etc)
@bytejunkie @Inc82 Should explain how to use the zoom then :)
@fraserharris Agree for sure! That's in our plan, I'm self a fan of shortcuts. Thx for your thoughts!
